Yeoman

Questions

  • Use frameworks (see value in generators)?
  • Have a defined build process? (compress, concatenate, minify, etc)
  • Use Compass/SASS?
  • Use CoffeeScript?
  • Use nodejs as your localhost server?

What is Yeoman?

  • Robust bootstrap
  • Code generation
  • Server + watching
  • Easy testing
  • Optimal build

Who is it for?

  • *NEW* apps

Demo time!

Before you get started

  • *Lots* of of dependencies!!!
  • platform tools: node, ruby, python, git
  • third-party tools:phantomjs, compass, ligjpeg-trubo, OptiPNG
  • node packages: bower, coffee-script, grunt, requirejs, and many others

How to install

  • Go to yeoman.io
  • Read directions :)
  • (If on Windows, use chocolatey: chocolatey.org), then "cinst yeoman"

Included

  • HTML5 Boilerplate
  • Twitter Bootstrap

The Pain

  • Obviously not a v1.0
  • Bower integration: install vs. init (components vs. vendor)
  • Build image optimization: stylesheets lose references
  • Build botches up references
  • Some generators just don't work
  • If something goes wrong during install, you're screwed

The Pleasure

  • 0-60mph in 3 seconds
  • Good practices (although opinionated)
  • Project structure
  • Integrated Build
  • Generators are great when they work

Advanced

  • Customizing support for frameworks
  • Building your own generators/templates

The future (huge changes ahead)

  • Yeoman will "only" be the scaffolding
  • Broken into many more tasks (working closely with Grunt)

Conclusions

  • It's still too early
  • Committing to it now means breaking changes later
  • Has fantastic potential
  • There are other options
  • Keep an eye on it
